trails.name: Abrams Falls
trails.description: A popular moderate hike that leads to a pretty 20-foot waterfall. Located in Cades Cove.

trails.name: Albright Grove Loop Trail
trails.description: This loop trail through an old growth forest is located off of the Maddron Bald Trail. Use the Maddron Bald trailhead to access.

trails.name: Alum Cave Hike
trails.description: This very popular hike takes you up to Alum Cave which isn't really a cave, but a rock overhang. One can continue on up to Mt. Leconte from this trail.

trails.name: Forney Ridge Trail/Andrews Bald
trails.description: This a relatively short, though moderate hike to Andrews Bald. Access from the Clingmons Dome parking area. This is a crowded area, but the moderate difficulty of the hike means less crowds on this trail.

trails.name: Avent Cabin
trails.description: Park at the Jakes Creek Trailhead in the ELkmont area of the park. This is a relatively short hike to an old historical cabin structure. The Elkmont area was a popular vacation resort prior to the area becoming a national park.

trails.name: Balsam High Top
trails.description: A strenuous hike that follows the Benton MacKaye Trail as it climbs up Balsam Mountain. There are no views at the top, so do this hike for the exercise and the solitude.

trails.name: Baskins Creek Falls
trails.description: A hike close to Gatlinburg where you can view waterfall, take a short side trip to a cemetery, and see some views of nearby ridges and Gatlinburg. Tip: park on Cherokee Orchard Road before the beginning of the one-way Roaring Fork Motor trail. Take a short walk up the road to find the trailhead. When you leave you can make a return trip on Cherokee Orchard Road and avoid the typical slow, heavy traffic Roaring Fork Motor Trail

trails.name: Mt. Cammerer
trails.description: This is a very challenging hike up to the top of Mt. Cammerer where you can see a commanding view of the surrounding mountains from an old fire lookout tower. This particular hike uses the Low Gap Trail from the Cosby area of the park. The hike up to the Appalachian Trail is demanding.

trails.name: The Jump Off
trails.description: This hike involves catching the Appalachian Trail from the Newfound Gap parking lot. Most of the hike is along this famous trail until you reach the Jump Off spur trail. At the Jump Off you'll have an amazing view.

trails.name: The Bullhead Trail
trails.description: Start this hike from the Rainbow Falls trailhead parking lot. This trail was closed for a few years due to the wildfire that struck the area in late 2016. This trail can be used to reach the top of Mt. Leconte but this particular hike is most famous for reaching 'The Pulpit', a large rock cairn built by the CCC in the 1930s.

hikes.name: Baskins Creek Falls
hikes.comments: Very hot hike and very dry until you reach the creek. Lots of bugs. Not one of my favorite hikes here.

hikes.name: Abrams Falls Trail
hikes.comments: Beautiful hike but very crowded. One of the busiest trails in the park.

hikes.name: Mt. Cammerer
hikes.comments: Long exhausting hike but amazing views from the fire lookout tower!
This is a long slog up a ridge without any views at the top. Do this for the exercise.
Beautiful view from an old firetower lookout tower at the top.
